snippet: Seeking capital punishment for a federal crime with no clear proof underscores the arbitrariness of the death penalty.
abstract: Editorial highlights Puerto Rico murder trial of Lashaun Casey, charged with 2005 killing of undercover narcotics officer; notes that Justice Department is pursuing death penalty in case, despite fact that capital punishment is unconstitutional in Puerto Rico; asserts that facts of case underscore how arbitrary death penalty is and why it should be abolished.
lead_paragraph: Seeking capital punishment for a federal crime with no clear proof underscores the arbitrariness of the death penalty.
